spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Fey Champion's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, spell attack +9). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The fey champion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the fey champion to sleep.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
entries: The fey champion has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The fey champion has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The fey champion ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its shortsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Shortsword of the Feywild
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Shortbow of the Feywild
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Fey Champion adds a +6 to its AC against a single melee attack.

Fey Champions are mighty warriors who honed their fighting skills in the feywild. To elves and other fey who fight to protect themselves or even their homes, champions fight for the Feywild as a whole.

trait.name: Fiery Death and Rebirth
entries: When the faenix dies, it explodes. Each creature within 60-feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't worn or carried.

The explosion destroys the faenix's body and leaves behind an egg-shaped seed that weighs 5 pounds. The seed is burningly cold, dealing 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The seed is immune to all damage, and after {@dice 2d6} days, it hatches a new faenix.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The faenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Any creature that touches the faenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. In addition, the faenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. With a touch, the faenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren't worn or carried (no action required).

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The faenix doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The faenix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Feywild Flames
entries: The faenix ignores any damage resistances or immunity to fire damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The faenix has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the faenix to sleep.

trait.name: Cold Flames
entries: The faenix can replace its fire damage with cold damage if it so chooses.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The faenix makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its fiery talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Fiery Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) fire damage.

The Faenix is an Elemental birthed from the Feywild, a response to the Elementals during the Planar War. The Faenix was a fierce weapon from the Feywild as its fire burned coldly. It is said that its fire could harm any creature, including those who were supposed to be naturally resistant to fire. Though it is indeed a powerful recreation of the Elemental Phoenix, it is not a perfect replica.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Siren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Siren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) psychic damage while the target is {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Stupefying Touch
entries: Siren touches one creature she can see within 5 feet of her. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the start of Siren's next turn.

action.name: Luring Song
entries: The siren sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the siren that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The siren must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the siren is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by the siren, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and ignores the songs of other siren. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the siren, the target must move on its turn toward the siren by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the siren, the target can repeat the saving throw. A {@condition charmed} target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this siren's song for the next 24 hours.
Originally, sirens were what are now known as the harpies. As time went on, the depiction of the sirens evolved into the fey we now know them as.

Sirens are fey that are spiteful toward mankind. Their beauty and lustful singing can enchant the hearts of even the strongest men and lure them to the Siren, similarly as the harpies do. When their prey are lured in to their lair, they devour those who are foolish and weak enough to fall for their enchantments. Few return with their lives to tell the tale, and fewer return claiming they had slain the creature.

monster.name: Winter Walker
languages: Understands Sylvan but does not speak it

trait.name: Freezing Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Winter Walker must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and grant the Winter Walker advantage on attack rolls against it until the start of the creature's next turn. The affected creatures also suffers disadvantage on attack rolls and their movement speed is reduced by 10 ft. Creatures with resistance to cold damage have advantage on the saving throw.

trait.name: Limited Invisibility
entries: While the winter walker is in a blizzard, it is {@condition invisible}. It can still be partially visible but only by creatures with a 15 passive perception or higher, canceling the effects of it's limited invisibility. It appears as a translucent ghost while within this limited invisibility.

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
entries: If the winter walker takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nightwalker uses Frostbitten Touch twice, or it uses Frostbitten Touch and Chilling Doom, if available.

action.name: Frostbitten Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

action.name: Chilling Doom {@recharge}
entries: The winter walker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 3d12}) cold damage and become {@condition frightened} until the end of the winter walker's next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature is also {@condition paralyzed}. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the winter walker's Chilling Doom for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The winter walker exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Unknown to most travelers, there is a monster that can only be found during the winter times, where the Feywild and the material plane converges the most.

The Unseelie Court created a creature bound by a curse that infects other creatures with this same curse. The creature walks aimlessly until the death of winter. If it comes across any travelers, it thoughtlessly attacks. This creature's main drive is to protect the crossroads between the Feywild and the material plane, however it is void of any form of sanity or consciousness. It has no real thoughts, only about the fight and how it will kill its current or next prey.

When winter comes to an end, the creature fades away. Supposedly, there is a section of the Feywild that is in an endless winter, which is where these Winter Walkers go to wander until the next winter comes.
As a fail safe, they gave the creature an unnatural weakness to fire in case these monsters decided to turn against them.
